author: Simon Mullock
title: Yaya Toure set to complete staggering Manchester City U-turn as Pep Guardiola hints at new Etihad deal
text:
Toure could be set to stay at City (Photo: Dan Mullan) Share Get daily     
Pep Guardiola has opened the door for a spectacular U-turn over Yaya Toure’s future. 
The 33 year-old midfielder is set to be offered a new Manchester City contract. 
And Toure’s rollercoaster season will take another upwards turn with his recall to City’s Champions League squad at the end of the month. 
And City boss Guardiola has also hinted that the 33-year-old could extend his seven-year stay at the Etihad into next season. 
In a remarkable turnaround, Guardiola said: “With Yaya we will talk about contracts at the end of the season. Guardiola on the touchline (Photo: Arfa Griffiths) Yaya Toure scores against West Ham (Photo: Catherine Ivill - AMA/Getty) 
“But he will definitely be in the Champions League squad. He deserves it. 
“In the first part of the season Yaya wasn’t in the squad because of physical reasons - and we all know the second part why he didn’t play. 
“But, of course, he now deserves to be in the Champions League squad in the next round.” 
Toure’s future at City looked bleak when Guardiola omitted him from his European squad at the end of August because he wasn’t deemed fit enough. Yaya Toure appeared on his way at the start of the season (Photo: Reuters) A young City fan shows his support (Photo: Getty) 
The decision prompted the player’s agent, Dimitri Seluk, to tell Sunday Mirror Sport that Guardiola had humiliated the four-time African Footballer of the Year. 
The City boss responded by leaving Toure out of his domestic plans until an apology was forthcoming. 
And Toure took to Facebook in November to make his peace.
